profile_data.summary:
Greetings!

üéìI'm a master's graduate in Data Science from Columbia University, equipped with a strong foundation in the realms of Data Science, Machine Learning (ML), and Natural Language Processing (NLP)

üí°From unraveling the mysteries hidden in data to devising ingenious ML & NLP models, my passion for data-driven problem-solving has led me to make substantial contributions across diverse domains. As a versatile Data Scientist, I've delved into intricate projects spanning various industries, extracting actionable insights to fuel informed decision-making, drive innovation and optimize solutions

üë©‚ÄçüíªTechnical skills:
-Programming skills: Python, SQL, R, C++
-Data Technologies: AWS(S3, Glue, Redshift, SageMaker, EC2, Athena, DBT), GCP, Apache Spark

Tools, packages & other skills: 
-Pandas, Numpy, dplyr,  ggplot2, matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, NLTK, spaCy, Plotly, Tableau, MySQL, CI/CD, A/B Testing, Jupyter, RStudio,  Git, Jira, MS Excel

üåçLet's connect and engage in Collaborative Learning Ventures!

Feel free to reach out to me at: ps3312@columbia.edu
GitHub: https://github.com/poojasrini

experience.description: Worked at DitecT Lab, focusing on Large Language Models in Transportation. Conducted research on ontology generation for scenario-based testing in Autonomous Driving Systems and explored the integration of Knowledge Graphs (KG) in LLM and LLM with KG.
experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant

experience.description:
‚Ä¢ Pioneered the development of a two-tiered Stacked Large Language Model (LLM) Chatbot, utilizing AWS Bedrock for optimal performance. This innovative solution, featuring LLM1 and LLM2, enabled precise SQL command generation and human-readable data summaries.
‚Ä¢ Applied advanced fine-tuning techniques, like few-shot prompting and chain-of-thoughts approach, to enhance Stacked LLMs' accuracy. Evaluated models such as Jurassic 2 Ultra, Claude V2, Command V14.6, Llama 2 13b, and Code Llama 13b.
‚Ä¢ Spearheaded the development of a precise heuristic cost estimation model for Environment Conservation Measures (ECMs) in building upgrades, leveraging market research and innovative OOPs coding to replace a less effective ML clustering technique.
experience.title: Data Science Intern

experience.description:
‚Ä¢ Leveraged AWS Redshift for ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, handling 200M rows. Utilized AWS SageMaker for preprocessing & EDA. Generated data visualizations to unveil trends and identify crucial fields for data replacement
‚Ä¢ Established data mappings between multiple datasets designing Gradient Boosting and Random Forest Algorithm for seamless integration and scaling
‚Ä¢ Orchestrated data lake updates and improved user experience by collaborating with cross-functional teams, utilizing AWS services (EC2, S3, Glue), querying & executing CI/CD tasks with the Data build tool (dbt)
‚Ä¢ Conducted data wrangling in 311 data, 25 cities (2M rows each) & scripted complaint location identification improving performance by 30%; Optimized large language model (Llama 2) for keyword-based cost analysis, enhancing precision sales targeting by 50%
experience.title: Data Science Intern

honors.description: Won 3rd place for the problem statement 'Radio Link Failure Prediction' at ITU AI/ML in 5G Challenge, an international contest with over 100 teams. Identified solution to predict the occurrence of radio link failure, given the weather forecast conditions around the link station in any of next 5 days. The model proposed has F1 score for failure of 1 day as 40% and 44% of 5 days.
honors.title: ITU AI/ML in 5G Challenge 2021
honors.issuer: AI for Good - ITU AI/ML in 5G Challenge

honors.description: Won the best paper award for the project titled "Prediction of COVID-19 State-wise Incidence using semi-supervised learning with Graph Convolutional Networks". In this project I trained GNNs to classify COVID-19 severity level by modelling states and borders in India as a graph. Combined semi-supervised learning with pre-pandemic census information such as foreign visitor count and health index of only 6 states to achieve 82% accuracy, a 15% improvement over non-graph-based models.
honors.title: Zenith'21 - Best Paper Award
honors.issuer: ZENITH'21, Tech Club, SSN College of Engineering

honors.description: Received Silver Medal for securing second place in the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering (5th semester)
honors.title: Silver Medalist

honors.description: Selected for a fully funded research internship from Western University, Ontario, Canada under the supervision of Prof. Mohammad Reza Najafi for the project titled "Probabilistic flood forecasting using teleconnection signals" from May to August 2021. This research internship was successfully completed with the development of a flood forecasting model.
honors.title: Mitacs Globalink Research Scholar 2021

member.occupation: Data Scientist @American Express | Columbia University | GHC'23 | NLP | Machine Learning

projects.description: Developed recommendation pipeline to heighten profit margins, leveraging content-based and collaborative filtering suggesting top-n customer recommendations based on purchase histories. Additionally, employed K-means Clustering and Neural Networks for image similarity recommendations, yielding a significant 33% improvement and delivering valuable business market insights
projects.title: Customer fashion product recommender system

member.occupation: Data Scientist @American Express | Columbia University | GHC'23 | NLP | Machine Learning

projects.description: The research work makes use of novel Pre-processing (Upsampling, downsampling, date-time analysis, categorical encoding, closest weather station based on distance, normalizing) and Feature Engineering techniques (Correlation Based Approach, Backward Elimination and Recursive Feature Elimination), followed by a trained Decision Tree model to predict the occurrence of Radio Link Failure (RLF). The system is designed to predict RLF for not just the next day, but also any of the next 5 days. This prediction supports reliance and increasing demand for good internet connectivity. In order to achieve accurate RLF prediction, comprehensive data from ITU has been used. Macro-averaged F1 score and G-Mean score was used for evaluation. Decreased latency and increased communication reliability was achieved. Won 3rd place for the problem statement in ITU-AI/ML in 5G challenge 2021.
projects.title: Decision Tree-based Radio Link Failure Prediction for 5G Communication Reliability

member.occupation: Data Scientist @American Express | Columbia University | GHC'23 | NLP | Machine Learning

projects.description: 'Pooraa Agri KG: An Agricultural Knowledge Graph-based Multilingual Query System' works in real-time to answer agriculture-based queries in a concise format (basic grammar & vocabulary) and in a widely spoken native language (accepts queries and answers in Hindi). Data corpus collected from India Linguistic Resource, TDIL consisting of 15k sentences. Performed Natural Language Processing (NLP) based complex sentence segmentation using dependency parsing, knowledge graph extraction using spacy & reconstruction of sentences using heuristic algorithm, machine translation to handle native language. A query system using cosine similarity and Euclidean distance was built.
projects.title: Pooraa Agri KG: An Agricultural Knowledge Graph Based Multilingual Query System

member.occupation: Data Scientist @American Express | Columbia University | GHC'23 | NLP | Machine Learning

projects.description:
Worked on the research project titled: "Improving probabilistic flood forecasting using teleconnection signals". Quantified the contribution of teleconnection signals to floods in Canada. Processed and analyzed a large suit of global climate data sample (30 years (1980-2010) precipitation data in NetCDF format for entire Canada) using a python model. Further, Spatial and temporal analysis of wet and concurrent wet events were performed by time series analysis using
standardized precipitation index (SPI). The trend was obtained using Man-Kendall test and hence the prediction of the occurrence of floods.
projects.title: Improving probabilistic flood forecasting using teleconnection signals

member.occupation: Data Scientist @American Express | Columbia University | GHC'23 | NLP | Machine Learning

projects.description: Trained GNNs to classify COVID-19 severity level by modeling states and borders in India as a graph. Combined semi-supervised learning with pre-pandemic census information such as foreign visitor count and health index of only 6 states to achieve 82% accuracy, a 15% improvement over non-graph-based models; Won best paper at ZENITH‚Äô21, SSN Tech Club symposium.
projects.title: Graph Convolutional Networks for Predicting State-wise Pandemic Incidence in India

member.occupation: Data Scientist @American Express | Columbia University | GHC'23 | NLP | Machine Learning

projects.description: ‚ÄòAttribute Based Double Bounded Rough Neutrosophic sets (DBRNS) in Facial expression detection‚Äô research paper deals with analyzing the values of Neutrosophic fuzzy set (membership, non-membership, indeterminacy) and attribute value for facial expression detection (happy, angry, sad and surprised). Python model was built to determine the same for given 7,000 images and their parameters at various pivotal points of the face/object using the concept of DBRNS. Detection with and without mask, differentiating fake and genuine smile, degree of closeness and depression were also obtained.
projects.title: Attribute based Double Bounded Rough Neutrosophic Sets (DBRNS) in Facial Expression Detection
